item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "For West is where we all plan to go some day. It is where you go when the land gives out and the old-field pines encroach. It is where you go when you get the letter saying: Flee, all is discovered. It is where you go when you look down at the blade in your hand and the blood on it. It is where you go when you are told that you are a bubble on the tide of empire. It is where you go when you hear that thar's gold in them-thar hills. It is where you go to grow up with the country. It is where you go to spend your old age. Or it is just where you go." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Charles Bowden
item.description: "Summertime is always the best of what might be." -- Charles Bowden

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Beware of the man who works hard to learn something, learns it, and finds himself no wiser than before. He is full of murderous resentment of people who are ignorant without having come by their ignorance the hard way." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ashley add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "The end of man is knowledge, but there is one thing he can't know. He can't know whether knowledge will save him or kill him. He will be killed, all right, but he can't know whether he is killed because of the knowledge which he has got or because of the knowledge which he hasn't got and which if he had it, would save him." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "Historical sense and poetic sense should not, in the end, be contradictory, for if poetry is the little myth we make, history is the big myth we live, and in our living, constantly remake." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "[A]nd soon now we shall go out of the house and go into the convulsion of the world, out of history into history and the awful responsibility of Time." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Ashley add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Everybody is identical in their secret unspoken belief that way deep down they are different from everyone else." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "We often miss opportunity because it's dressed in overalls and looks like work" -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Adrienne Rich
item.description: "There must be those among whom we can sit down and weep and still be counted as warriors." -- Adrienne Rich

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "No, no! The adventures first, explanations take such a dreadful time." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Caitlin Moran
item.description: "You can tell whether some misogynistic societal pressure is being exerted on women by calmly enquiring, ‘And are the men doing this, as well?’ If they aren’t, chances are you’re dealing with what we strident feminists refer to as ‘some total fucking bullshit’." -- Caitlin Moran

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "Politics is a matter of choices, and a man doesn't set up the choices himself. And there is always a price to make a choice. You know that. You've made a choice, and you know how much it cost you. There is always a price." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: ". . . the Yankee dollar and Confederate dumbness combined to heal the wounds of four years of fratricidal strife. . ." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "Sometimes sleep gets to be a serious and complete thing. You stop going to sleep in order that you may be able to get up, but get up in order that you may be able to go back to sleep." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Ashley add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "What is hardest to accept about the passage of time is that the people who once mattered the most to us wind up in parentheses." -- John Irving

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "And what we students of history always learn is that the human being is a very complicated contraption and that they are not good or bad but are good and bad and the good comes out of the bad and the bad out of the good, and the devil take the hindmost." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "If something takes too long, something happens to you. You become all and only the thing you want and nothing else, for you have paid too much for it, too much in wanting and too much in waiting and too much in getting." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "History cannot give us a program for the future, but it can give us a fuller understanding of ourselves, and of our common humanity, so that we can better face the future." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "What is love?/One name for it is knowledge." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Richard Hofstadter
item.description: "What came in the end was only a small war and a quick victory; when the farmers and the gentlemen finally did coalesce in politics, they produced only the genial reforms of Progressivism; and the man on the white horse turned out to be just a graduate of the Harvard boxing squad, equipped with an immense bag of platitudes, and quite willing to play the democratic game." -- Richard Hofstadter

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "History will be kind to me for I intend to write it." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Howard Phillips Lovecraft
item.description: "Almost nobody dances sober, unless they happen to be insane." -- Howard Phillips Lovecraft

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "Storytelling and copulation are the two chief forms of amusement in the South. They’re inexpensive and easy to procure. " -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Ashley add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Knowledge can last, principles can last, habits can last; but feelings come and go... But, of course, ceasing to be "in love" need not mean ceasing to love. Love in this second sense — love as distinct from "being in love" — is not merely a feeling. It is a deep unity, maintained by the will and deliberately strengthened by habit; reinforced by (in Christian marriage) the grace which both partners ask, and receive, from God... "Being in love" first moved them to promise fidelity: this quieter love enables them to keep the promise. It is on this love that the engine of marriage is run: being in love was the explosion that started it." -- C.S. Lewis
